start_content.title: Only good rap
start_content.text:
I rap as much as 
I can at any time of the day

card_1.title: History of Hip-Hop
card_1.text: Hip-hop was born in the Bronx in the 1970s as a subculture of young people, combining music, dance, graffiti and rap. Today it is a global phenomenon shaping culture and society.

card_2.title: Hip-Hop Values
card_2.text: Hip-hop is not just music, it is also a philosophy of life. It encompasses values such as self-knowledge, self-expression and fighting against social injustice.

card_3.title: Great Hip-Hop Artists
card_3.text: Hip-hop is a genre that has given birth to many unforgettable artists, from Tupac Shakur and Notorious B.I.G. to Kendrick Lamar and Cardi B. Their music inspires and raises public awareness.

card_1.title: Marian
card_1.text: A hip-hop legend, complex beats are his games. He has the magic to create, which makes him unmatched on the scene.

card_2.title: Baker
card_2.text: A prodigious talent, he raps with passion and speed, like a street poet. His lyrics are the essence of life on the streets of the city, without wrapping it in cotton.

card_3.title: Neo
card_3.text: Hiphop of the future, he rhymes about technology and social change. His flow is as futuristic as his lyrics, which flow like a stream of data.

card_4.title: David
card_4.text: He tells life stories, and there is a depth of emotion in his raps. David's words penetrate the soul, conveying real experiences from the streets.
